page.title: 01BELCHFORD - A WOLDS VILLAGE
page.content: The block covers approximately one third of the parish of Belchford including the centre of the village and part of some of the farms. Belchford is situated in a deep attractive valley of the southern Lincolnshire Wolds five miles north east of the market town of Horncastle, in an area which has been designated by the County Council as being of outstanding natural beauty. the land area of the parish is 2542 acres. Belchford is a 'double-ring' village with narrow internal lanes forming a rough figure-of-eight. The River Waring rises in the parish. There are 91 dwellings in the parish housing a population of 216, of which 111 are male and 105 female. All but six live within the block. The parish is wholly agricultural in character, no manufacturing or craft industries now
